name: MyGiftster Corporation
overview:
A free “high design” service combining wish lists, gift registry, event calendar, and a news feed to connect family and close friends around gift giving occasions for a lifetime.

Going after the $14 billion dollar problem of annual economic loss in the United States due to inherent problems with gift giving. A prominent economics professor calculated that this amount is the difference between what gift givers paid for items, and what the recipients actually valued them at. Giftster is one way to solve this problem - matching gift giving with items the recipient really needs or wants, exactly.

Real time list syncing between the website, iPhone app, and m.giftster for Android and others.

Has been in beta past 24 months to fine tune before a more general launch later in 2012.

Service is live and has several thousand active members.

Grows virally via family members and then family to family.

Revenue from Google Adsense and affiliate commissions has been tested so far with good success.

Uses “groups” and provides for a group “administrator” to define a list of family members and who can reserve items on each other’s lists.

Open to strategic alliances.

milestones.description: Launched m.giftster for Android and other mobile platforms
Giftster mentioned in Wall Street Journal
